content.text:
======================== CODE SNIPPETS ======================== TITLE: TanStack Router Advanced Routing Features Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configures advanced features like virtual file routes, API base URLs, and automatic code splitting. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/api/file-based-routing.md#_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: APIDOC CODE: ``` virtualRouteConfig: - Description: Configures the Virtual File Routes feature. See the "Virtual File Routes" guide for more information. - Default: undefined apiBase: - Description: Base URL for API routes. - Default: undefined autoCodeSplitting: - Description: Enables automatic code splitting for routes. - Default: undefined disableTypes: - Description: If true, disables TypeScript type generation for the route tree. The generated route tree will be saved with the .js extension instead of .ts. - Default: undefined disableLogging: - Description: If true, disables logging messages. - Default: undefined ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: TanStack Router File Naming and Token Configuration DESCRIPTION: Defines prefixes, ignore patterns, and tokens for identifying route files, layout routes, and index routes within the routing system. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/api/file-based-routing.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: APIDOC CODE: ``` routeFilePrefix: - Description: Prefix to identify route files. Only files starting with this prefix are considered for routing. - Default: "" routeFileIgnorePrefix: - Description: Prefix to ignore specific files and directories in the route directory. - Default: "-" - Example: ```txt src/routes â”œâ”€â”€ posts â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ -components // Ignored â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ Post.tsx â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ index.tsx â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ route.tsx ``` routeFileIgnorePattern: - Description: Regular expression pattern to ignore specific files and directories. - Default: undefined - Example: ".((css|const).ts)|test-page" routeToken: - Description: Token to identify layout route files. A layout route is rendered at the specified path, and child routes are rendered within it. - Default: "route" - Example Filenames: ```txt src/routes/posts.tsx -> /posts src/routes/posts.route.tsx -> /posts src/routes/posts/route.tsx -> /posts ``` indexToken: - Description: Token to identify index route files. An index route is matched when the URL path is exactly the same as the parent route. - Default: "index" - Example Filenames: ```txt src/routes/posts.index.tsx -> /posts/ src/routes/posts/index.tsx -> /posts/ ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: addExtensions Configuration DESCRIPTION: Adds file extensions to the route names within the generated route tree. This approach is common for organizing larger route configurations. This approach avoids deep directory structures for routes. This allows for co-location of related logic without generating routes for these files. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/react/routing/routing-concepts.md#_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { createFileRoute } from '@tanstack/react-router' import { PostsTable } from './-posts-table' import { PostsHeader } from './-components/header' import { PostsFooter } from './-components/footer' export const Route = createFileRoute('/posts')({ loader: () => fetchPosts(), component: PostComponent, }) function PostComponent() { const posts = Route.useLoaderData() return (
) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: TanStack Router File-Based Routing Configuration Options DESCRIPTION: Details the various configuration options available for TanStack Router's file-based routing system, including directory paths, file naming conventions, and code generation settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/api/file-based-routing.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: APIDOC CODE: ``` TanStack Router File-Based Routing Configuration: Configuration options for TanStack Router's file-based routing system. - routesDirectory (required): Path to the directory where route files are located, relative to cwd. Default: "./src/routes". Cannot be an empty string or undefined. - generatedRouteTree (required): Path to the file where the generated route tree will be saved, relative to cwd. Default: "./src/routeTree.gen.ts". Uses .js extension if disableTypes is true. - virtualRouteConfig: Configures the Virtual File Routes feature. Default: undefined. - routeFilePrefix: Prefix to identify route files. Only files starting with this prefix are considered for routing. Default: "". - routeFileIgnorePrefix: Prefix to ignore specific files and directories in the route directory. Default: "-". - routeFileIgnorePattern: Regular expression pattern to ignore specific files and directories. Default: undefined. - indexToken: Token to identify index route files. Default: "index". - routeToken: Token to identify layout route files. Default: "route". - quoteStyle: Quote style for generated route tree files and new route files. Default: "single". - semicolons: If true, formats generated route tree files and new route files with semicolons. Default: false. - apiBase: Base URL for API routes. Default: undefined. - autoCodeSplitting: Enables automatic code splitting for routes. Default: undefined. - disableTypes: If true, disables TypeScript type generation for the route tree. Default: undefined. - addExtensions: If true, adds file extensions to generated route imports. Default: undefined. - disableLogging: If true, disables logging messages. Default: undefined. - routeTreeFileHeader: Custom header content for the generated route tree file. Default: undefined. - routeTreeFileFooter: Custom footer content for the generated route tree file. Default: undefined. - enableRouteTreeFormatting: Enables formatting for the generated route tree file. Default: undefined. - tmpDir: Path to the temporary directory used for routing operations. Default: undefined. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Define Virtual Routes Directly in tsr.config.json DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to define virtual routes directly within the `tsr.config.json` file. It allows for inline configuration of the route structure, including root, index, route, and layout types, with nested children and specific file paths. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/react/routing/virtual-file-routes.md#_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` // tsr.config.json { "virtualRouteConfig": { "type": "root", "file": "root.tsx", "children": [ { "type": "index", "file": "home.tsx" }, { "type": "route", "file": "posts/posts.tsx", "path": "/posts", "children": [ { "type": "index", "file": "posts/posts-home.tsx" }, { "type": "route", "file": "posts/posts-detail.tsx", "path": "$postId" } ] }, { "type": "layout", "id": "first", "file": "layout/first-pathless-layout.tsx", "children": [ { "type": "layout", "id": "second", "file": "layout/second-pathless-layout.tsx", "children": [ { "type": "route", "file": "a.tsx", "path": "/route-a" }, { "type": "route", "file": "b.tsx", "path": "/route-b" } ] } ] } ] } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: routeTreeFileHeader Configuration DESCRIPTION: Allows prepending custom content to the beginning of the generated route tree file. Useful for adding linting directives or comments. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/api/file-based-routing.md#_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: APIDOC CODE: ``` routeTreeFileHeader: string[] - Description: Content to prepend to the start of the generated route tree file. - Default: [ "/* eslint-disable */", "// @ts-nocheck", "// noinspection JSUnusedGlobalSymbols" ] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: routeTreeFileFooter Configuration DESCRIPTION: Allows appending custom content to the end of the generated route tree file. Useful for adding closing comments or exports. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/api/file-based-routing.md#_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: APIDOC CODE: ``` routeTreeFileFooter: string[] - Description: Content to append to the end of the generated route tree file. - Default: `[]` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configure Vite Plugin with Virtual Routes Path DESCRIPTION: Shows how to configure the TanStack Router Vite plugin to use an external virtual routes file. The `virtualRouteConfig` option is set to the path of the file containing the route definitions. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/react/routing/virtual-file-routes.md#_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { defineConfig } from 'vite' import react from '@vitejs/plugin-react' import { tanstackRouter } from '@tanstack/router-plugin/vite' export default defineConfig({ plugins: [ tanstackRouter({ target: 'react', virtualRouteConfig: './routes.ts', }), react(), ], }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: TanStack Router Route Directory and Generation Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configures the source directory for route files and the output path for the generated route tree. Includes settings for temporary directories. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/api/file-based-routing.md#_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: APIDOC CODE: ``` routesDirectory (required): - Description: Path to the directory where route files are located, relative to cwd. - Default: "./src/routes" - Constraints: Cannot be an empty string or undefined. generatedRouteTree (required): - Description: Path to the file where the generated route tree will be saved, relative to cwd. - Default: "./src/routeTree.gen.ts" - Behavior: Uses .js extension if disableTypes is true. tmpDir: - Description: Path to the temporary directory used for routing operations. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: tmpDir Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configures the path for the temporary directory used in atomic file writes. If not set, it falls back to `process.env.TSR_TMP_DIR` or `.tanstack/tmp`. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/api/file-based-routing.md#_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: APIDOC CODE: ``` tmpDir: string | undefined - Description: Path to the temporary directory for atomic file writes. - Behavior: - If relative, resolved to the current working directory. - If not set, uses `process.env.TSR_TMP_DIR`. - If `process.env.TSR_TMP_DIR` is not set, defaults to `.tanstack/tmp` relative to the current working directory. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Mixed Flat and Directory Routes Examples DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how TanStack Router allows seamless integration of both flat routing conventions (dot notation) and traditional directory-based routing. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/react/routing/file-based-routing.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: __root.tsx Route Path: Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: index.tsx Route Path: / Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: about.tsx Route Path: /about Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: posts.tsx Route Path: /posts Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Directory: posts/ Filename: index.tsx Route Path: /posts (exact) Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Directory: posts/ Filename: $postId.tsx Route Path: /posts/$postId Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Directory: posts/ Filename: $postId.edit.tsx Route Path: /posts/$postId/edit Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: settings.tsx Route Path: /settings Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: settings.profile.tsx Route Path: /settings/profile Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: settings.notifications.tsx Route Path: /settings/notifications Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: account.tsx Route Path: /account Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: account.overview.tsx Route Path: /account/overview Component Output: ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: TanStack Router Configuration File DESCRIPTION: Defines the configuration for TanStack Router's file-based routing, specifying the directory for route files and the output file for the generated route tree. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/react/migrate-from-react-location.md#_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "routesDirectory": "./src/routes", "generatedRouteTree": "./src/routeTree.gen.ts" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: disableTypes Configuration DESCRIPTION: Disables the generation of types for the route tree. If set to `true`, the generated route tree will be a `.js` file without types. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/api/file-based-routing.md#_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: APIDOC CODE: ``` disableTypes: boolean - Description: Disables generating types for the route tree. - Effect: Generated route tree will not include types and will be a `.js` file. - Default: `false` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configure Vite Plugin with Inline Virtual Routes DESCRIPTION: Illustrates configuring the TanStack Router Vite plugin by defining the virtual routes directly within the configuration file. This approach embeds the route tree definition inline, bypassing an external file. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/react/routing/virtual-file-routes.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { defineConfig } from 'vite' import react from '@vitejs/plugin-react' import { tanstackRouter } from '@tanstack/router-plugin/vite' import { rootRoute } from '@tanstack/virtual-file-routes' const routes = rootRoute('root.tsx', [ // ... the rest of your virtual route tree ]) export default defineConfig({ plugins: [tanstackRouter({ virtualRouteConfig: routes }), react()], }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: enableRouteTreeFormatting Configuration DESCRIPTION: Enables or disables code formatting for the generated route tree file. Enabling formatting can be time-consuming for large projects. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/api/file-based-routing.md#_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: APIDOC CODE: ``` enableRouteTreeFormatting: boolean - Description: Turns on formatting for the generated route tree file. - Note: Can be time-consuming for large projects. - Default: `true` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Server Route Path Conflicts DESCRIPTION: Highlights potential conflicts where multiple files could resolve to the same server route path, leading to errors. Only one handler file is permitted per route. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/start/framework/react/server-routes.md#_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: APIDOC CODE: ``` Unique Route Paths: Each route can only have a single handler file. The following files would all resolve to the same route path (`/users`) and would cause an error: - `/routes/users.index.ts` - `/routes/users.ts` - `/routes/users/index.ts` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Mount Directory with Physical Virtual Routes DESCRIPTION: Shows how to mount an entire directory of file-based routes under a specific URL path using the `physical` function. This allows mixing conventions within the route tree. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/react/routing/virtual-file-routes.md#_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { index, layout, physical, route, rootRoute } from '@tanstack/virtual-file-routes' export const routes = rootRoute('root.tsx', [ index('index.tsx'), layout('pathlessLayout.tsx', [ route('/dashboard', 'app/dashboard.tsx', [ index('app/dashboard-index.tsx'), route('/invoices', 'app/dashboard-invoices.tsx', [ index('app/invoices-index.tsx'), route('$id', 'app/invoice-detail.tsx'), ]), ]), physical('/posts', 'posts'), ]), ]) ``` ======================== QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS ======================== TOPIC: Q: How can you create a file-based route? A: You can create a file-based route using the `createFileRoute` function. This function is designed to work with file-based routing conventions, simplifying the process of defining routes based on your file structure. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/react/api/router.md#_qa_4 ---------------------------------------- TOPIC: TanStack Router Virtual File Routes Q: What is the purpose of virtual file routes in TanStack Router? A: Virtual file routes allow you to define routes based on a file structure, similar to how frameworks like Next.js handle routing. This approach simplifies route management by automatically generating routes from your file system. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/solid/routing/virtual-file-routes.md#_qa_0 ---------------------------------------- TOPIC: TanStack Router: File-Based Routing Q: What is file-based routing in TanStack Router? A: File-based routing is a method for configuring routes in TanStack Router by using the filesystem. Instead of defining routes in code, you create files and directories that mirror your application's URL structure. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/react/routing/file-based-routing.md#_qa_0 ---------------------------------------- TOPIC: Q: Which files and folders are excluded from the route tree based on file naming conventions? A: Files and folders with a `-` prefix are excluded from the route tree. They are not added to the `routeTree.gen.ts` file and can be used for colocation. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/react/routing/file-naming-conventions.md#_qa_5 ---------------------------------------- TOPIC: TanStack Router: File-Based Routing Q: How are dynamic route segments handled in file-based routing? A: Dynamic route segments are handled by prefixing the filename with a `$`. For instance, a file named `$postId.tsx` within a `posts` directory will create a route for `/posts/:postId`. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/react/routing/file-based-routing.md#_qa_6 ---------------------------------------- TOPIC: TanStack Router File Naming Conventions Q: What is the purpose of file-naming conventions in TanStack Router for React? A: File-naming conventions in TanStack Router for React help automatically generate routes based on your file structure. This simplifies routing configuration by mapping file paths to URL paths. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/solid/routing/file-naming-conventions.md#_qa_0 ---------------------------------------- TOPIC: TanStack Router: File-Based Routing Q: What are the benefits of using file-based routing? A: File-based routing offers simplicity, better organization mirroring URL structure, scalability, automatic code-splitting for performance, enhanced type-safety, and consistency across projects. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/react/routing/file-based-routing.md#_qa_1 ---------------------------------------- TOPIC: File-Based Routing API Reference Q: What are the configuration options available for TanStack Router's file-based routing? A: TanStack Router's file-based routing offers several configuration options including `routesDirectory`, `generatedRouteTree`, `virtualRouteConfig`, `routeFilePrefix`, `routeFileIgnorePrefix`, `indexToken`, `routeToken`, `quoteStyle`, `semicolons`, `apiBase`, `autoCodeSplitting`, `disableTypes`, `addExtensions`, `disableLogging`, `routeTreeFileHeader`, `routeTreeFileFooter`, `enableRouteTreeFormatting`, and `tmpDir`. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/api/file-based-routing.md#_qa_0 ---------------------------------------- TOPIC: TanStack Router: File-Based Routing Q: How is the root index route defined? A: The root index route, which corresponds to the application's base URL (`/`), is defined by an `index.tsx` file in the root directory. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/react/routing/file-based-routing.md#_qa_5 ---------------------------------------- TOPIC: TanStack Router Plugin Q: What is the TanStack Router Plugin? A: The TanStack Router Plugin is a tool that enhances TanStack Router with file-based routing capabilities. It allows you to define your routes based on the file structure of your project. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/packages/router-plugin/README.md#_qa_0

This can help in resolving routes more explicitly. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/api/file-based-routing.md#_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: APIDOC CODE: ``` addExtensions: boolean - Description: Adds file extensions to route names in the generated route tree. - Default: `false` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configure Virtual Routes with File Path in tsr.config.json DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to configure virtual file routes by providing a relative path to a TypeScript file containing the route definitions in the `tsr.config.json` file. This approach is common for organizing larger route configurations. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/react/routing/virtual-file-routes.md#_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` // tsr.config.json { "virtualRouteConfig": "./routes.ts" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Define Virtual Route Tree with TanStack Router DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to programmatically define a route tree using virtual file routes. It imports utility functions from '@tanstack/virtual-file-routes' to construct the route structure, mapping routes to physical files. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/react/routing/virtual-file-routes.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { rootRoute, route, index, layout, physical, } from '@tanstack/virtual-file-routes' export const routes = rootRoute('root.tsx', [ index('index.tsx'), layout('pathlessLayout.tsx', [ route('/dashboard', 'app/dashboard.tsx', [ index('app/dashboard-index.tsx'), route('/invoices', 'app/dashboard-invoices.tsx', [ index('app/invoices-index.tsx'), route('$id', 'app/invoice-detail.tsx'), ]), ]), physical('/posts', 'posts'), ]), ]) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Server Route File Naming Conventions DESCRIPTION: Illustrates TanStack Start's file-based routing conventions for server routes, showing how file names and directory structures map to API route paths. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/start/framework/react/server-routes.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: APIDOC CODE: ``` File Route Conventions: - `/routes/users.ts` -> `/users` - `/routes/users.index.ts` -> `/users` (also) - `/routes/users/$id.ts` -> `/users/$id` - `/routes/users/$id/posts.ts` -> `/users/$id/posts` - `/routes/users.$id.posts.ts` -> `/users/$id/posts` - `/routes/api/file/$.ts` -> `/api/file/$` - `/routes/my-script[.]js.ts` -> `/my-script.js` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Create Virtual Root Route with TanStack Router DESCRIPTION: Explains the usage of the `rootRoute` function to define the base of the virtual route tree. It takes a file name for the root component and an array of child routes. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/react/routing/virtual-file-routes.md#_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { rootRoute } from '@tanstack/virtual-file-routes' export const routes = rootRoute('root.tsx', [ // ... children routes ]) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: File-Based Routing Structure Mapping DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how directory and file names in your project map to route paths and the components that render them. This structure allows for automatic code-splitting and type-safe routing configurations. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/react/routing/file-based-routing.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: file-structure CODE: ``` Filename/Directory | Route Path | Component Output ---------------------|------------|------------------ Ê¦ `__root.tsx` | | `` Ê¦ `index.tsx` | `/` (exact)| `` Ê¦ `about.tsx` | `/about` | `` Ê¦ `posts.tsx` | `/posts` | `` ðŸ“‚ `posts` | | â”„ Ê¦ `index.tsx` | `/posts` (exact)| `` â”„ Ê¦ `$postId.tsx` | `/posts/$postId`| `` ðŸ“‚ `posts_` | | â”„ ðŸ“‚ `$postId` | | â”„ â”„ Ê¦ `edit.tsx` | `/posts/$postId/edit`| `` Ê¦ `settings.tsx` | `/settings`| `` ðŸ“‚ `settings` | | `` â”„ Ê¦ `profile.tsx` | `/settings/profile`| `` â”„ Ê¦ `notifications.tsx` | `/settings/notifications`| `` Ê¦ `_pathlessLayout.tsx` | | `` ðŸ“‚ `_pathlessLayout` | | â”„ Ê¦ `route-a.tsx` | `/route-a` | `` â”„ Ê¦ `route-b.tsx` | `/route-b` | `` ðŸ“‚ `files` | | â”„ Ê¦ `$.tsx` | `/files/$` | `` ðŸ“‚ `account` | | â”„ Ê¦ `route.tsx` | `/account` | `` â”„ Ê¦ `overview.tsx` | `/account/overview`| `` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Flat Routing Examples DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how filenames with dot notation map to nested route paths in TanStack Router. This approach avoids deep directory structures for routes. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/react/routing/file-based-routing.md#_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: __root.tsx Route Path: Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: index.tsx Route Path: / Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: about.tsx Route Path: /about Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: posts.tsx Route Path: /posts Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: posts.index.tsx Route Path: /posts (exact) Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: posts.$postId.tsx Route Path: /posts/$postId Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: posts_.$postId.edit.tsx Route Path: /posts/$postId/edit Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: settings.tsx Route Path: /settings Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: settings.profile.tsx Route Path: /settings/profile Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: settings.notifications.tsx Route Path: /settings/notifications Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: _pathlessLayout.tsx Route Path: Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: _pathlessLayout.route-a.tsx Route Path: /route-a Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: _pathlessLayout.route-b.tsx Route Path: /route-b Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: files.$.tsx Route Path: /files/$ Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: account.tsx Route Path: /account Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: account.overview.tsx Route Path: /account/overview Component Output: ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Define Virtual Route with File Reference DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates creating a virtual route using the `route` function. This function requires a path, a file name for the route's component, and an optional array of child routes. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/react/routing/virtual-file-routes.md#_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { route } from '@tanstack/virtual-file-routes' export const routes = rootRoute('root.tsx', [ route('/about', 'about.tsx', [ // ... children routes ]), ]) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing from Excluded Files in Routes DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how to import components or utilities from files and folders that are excluded from route generation by prefixing their names with a hyphen. This allows for co-location of related logic without generating routes for these files. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/react/routing/routing-concepts.md#_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { createFileRoute } from '@tanstack/react-router' import { PostsTable } from './-posts-table' import { PostsHeader } from './-components/header' import { PostsFooter } from './-components/footer' export const Route = createFileRoute('/posts')({ loader: () => fetchPosts(), component: PostComponent, }) function PostComponent() { const posts = Route.useLoaderData() return (
) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: TanStack Router File-Based Routing Configuration Options DESCRIPTION: Details the various configuration options available for TanStack Router's file-based routing system, including directory paths, file naming conventions, and code generation settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/api/file-based-routing.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: APIDOC CODE: ``` TanStack Router File-Based Routing Configuration: Configuration options for TanStack Router's file-based routing system. - routesDirectory (required): Path to the directory where route files are located, relative to cwd. Default: "./src/routes". Cannot be an empty string or undefined. - generatedRouteTree (required): Path to the file where the generated route tree will be saved, relative to cwd. Default: "./src/routeTree.gen.ts". Uses .js extension if disableTypes is true. - virtualRouteConfig: Configures the Virtual File Routes feature. Default: undefined. - routeFilePrefix: Prefix to identify route files. Only files starting with this prefix are considered for routing. Default: "". - routeFileIgnorePrefix: Prefix to ignore specific files and directories in the route directory. Default: "-". - routeFileIgnorePattern: Regular expression pattern to ignore specific files and directories. Default: undefined. - indexToken: Token to identify index route files. Default: "index". - routeToken: Token to identify layout route files. Default: "route". - quoteStyle: Quote style for generated route tree files and new route files. Default: "single". - semicolons: If true, formats generated route tree files and new route files with semicolons. Default: false. - apiBase: Base URL for API routes. Default: undefined. - autoCodeSplitting: Enables automatic code splitting for routes. Default: undefined. - disableTypes: If true, disables TypeScript type generation for the route tree. Default: undefined. - addExtensions: If true, adds file extensions to generated route imports. Default: undefined. - disableLogging: If true, disables logging messages. Default: undefined. - routeTreeFileHeader: Custom header content for the generated route tree file. Default: undefined. - routeTreeFileFooter: Custom footer content for the generated route tree file. Default: undefined. - enableRouteTreeFormatting: Enables formatting for the generated route tree file. Default: undefined. - tmpDir: Path to the temporary directory used for routing operations. Default: undefined. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Define Virtual Routes Directly in tsr.config.json DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to define virtual routes directly within the `tsr.config.json` file. It allows for inline configuration of the route structure, including root, index, route, and layout types, with nested children and specific file paths. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/react/routing/virtual-file-routes.md#_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` // tsr.config.json { "virtualRouteConfig": { "type": "root", "file": "root.tsx", "children": [ { "type": "index", "file": "home.tsx" }, { "type": "route", "file": "posts/posts.tsx", "path": "/posts", "children": [ { "type": "index", "file": "posts/posts-home.tsx" }, { "type": "route", "file": "posts/posts-detail.tsx", "path": "$postId" } ] }, { "type": "layout", "id": "first", "file": "layout/first-pathless-layout.tsx", "children": [ { "type": "layout", "id": "second", "file": "layout/second-pathless-layout.tsx", "children": [ { "type": "route", "file": "a.tsx", "path": "/route-a" }, { "type": "route", "file": "b.tsx", "path": "/route-b" } ] } ] } ] } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: routeTreeFileHeader Configuration DESCRIPTION: Allows prepending custom content to the beginning of the generated route tree file. Useful for adding linting directives or comments. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/api/file-based-routing.md#_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: APIDOC CODE: ``` routeTreeFileHeader: string[] - Description: Content to prepend to the start of the generated route tree file. - Default: [ "/* eslint-disable */", "// @ts-nocheck", "// noinspection JSUnusedGlobalSymbols" ] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: routeTreeFileFooter Configuration DESCRIPTION: Allows appending custom content to the end of the generated route tree file. Useful for adding closing comments or exports. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/api/file-based-routing.md#_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: APIDOC CODE: ``` routeTreeFileFooter: string[] - Description: Content to append to the end of the generated route tree file. - Default: `[]` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configure Vite Plugin with Virtual Routes Path DESCRIPTION: Shows how to configure the TanStack Router Vite plugin to use an external virtual routes file. The `virtualRouteConfig` option is set to the path of the file containing the route definitions. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/react/routing/virtual-file-routes.md#_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { defineConfig } from 'vite' import react from '@vitejs/plugin-react' import { tanstackRouter } from '@tanstack/router-plugin/vite' export default defineConfig({ plugins: [ tanstackRouter({ target: 'react', virtualRouteConfig: './routes.ts', }), react(), ], }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: TanStack Router Route Directory and Generation Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configures the source directory for route files and the output path for the generated route tree. Includes settings for temporary directories. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/api/file-based-routing.md#_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: APIDOC CODE: ``` routesDirectory (required): - Description: Path to the directory where route files are located, relative to cwd. - Default: "./src/routes" - Constraints: Cannot be an empty string or undefined. generatedRouteTree (required): - Description: Path to the file where the generated route tree will be saved, relative to cwd. - Default: "./src/routeTree.gen.ts" - Behavior: Uses .js extension if disableTypes is true. tmpDir: - Description: Path to the temporary directory used for routing operations. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: tmpDir Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configures the path for the temporary directory used in atomic file writes. If not set, it falls back to `process.env.TSR_TMP_DIR` or `.tanstack/tmp`. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/api/file-based-routing.md#_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: APIDOC CODE: ``` tmpDir: string | undefined - Description: Path to the temporary directory for atomic file writes. - Behavior: - If relative, resolved to the current working directory. - If not set, uses `process.env.TSR_TMP_DIR`. - If `process.env.TSR_TMP_DIR` is not set, defaults to `.tanstack/tmp` relative to the current working directory. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Mixed Flat and Directory Routes Examples DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how TanStack Router allows seamless integration of both flat routing conventions (dot notation) and traditional directory-based routing. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/react/routing/file-based-routing.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: __root.tsx Route Path: Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: index.tsx Route Path: / Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: about.tsx Route Path: /about Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: posts.tsx Route Path: /posts Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Directory: posts/ Filename: index.tsx Route Path: /posts (exact) Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Directory: posts/ Filename: $postId.tsx Route Path: /posts/$postId Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Directory: posts/ Filename: $postId.edit.tsx Route Path: /posts/$postId/edit Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: settings.tsx Route Path: /settings Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: settings.profile.tsx Route Path: /settings/profile Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: settings.notifications.tsx Route Path: /settings/notifications Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: account.tsx Route Path: /account Component Output: ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` Filename: account.overview.tsx Route Path: /account/overview Component Output: ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: TanStack Router Configuration File DESCRIPTION: Defines the configuration for TanStack Router's file-based routing, specifying the directory for route files and the output file for the generated route tree. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/react/migrate-from-react-location.md#_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "routesDirectory": "./src/routes", "generatedRouteTree": "./src/routeTree.gen.ts" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: disableTypes Configuration DESCRIPTION: Disables the generation of types for the route tree. If set to `true`, the generated route tree will be a `.js` file without types. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/api/file-based-routing.md#_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: APIDOC CODE: ``` disableTypes: boolean - Description: Disables generating types for the route tree. - Effect: Generated route tree will not include types and will be a `.js` file. - Default: `false` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configure Vite Plugin with Inline Virtual Routes DESCRIPTION: Illustrates configuring the TanStack Router Vite plugin by defining the virtual routes directly within the configuration file. This approach embeds the route tree definition inline, bypassing an external file. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/react/routing/virtual-file-routes.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { defineConfig } from 'vite' import react from '@vitejs/plugin-react' import { tanstackRouter } from '@tanstack/router-plugin/vite' import { rootRoute } from '@tanstack/virtual-file-routes' const routes = rootRoute('root.tsx', [ // ... the rest of your virtual route tree ]) export default defineConfig({ plugins: [tanstackRouter({ virtualRouteConfig: routes }), react()], }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: enableRouteTreeFormatting Configuration DESCRIPTION: Enables or disables code formatting for the generated route tree file. Enabling formatting can be time-consuming for large projects. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/api/file-based-routing.md#_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: APIDOC CODE: ``` enableRouteTreeFormatting: boolean - Description: Turns on formatting for the generated route tree file. - Note: Can be time-consuming for large projects. - Default: `true` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Server Route Path Conflicts DESCRIPTION: Highlights potential conflicts where multiple files could resolve to the same server route path, leading to errors. Only one handler file is permitted per route. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/start/framework/react/server-routes.md#_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: APIDOC CODE: ``` Unique Route Paths: Each route can only have a single handler file. The following files would all resolve to the same route path (`/users`) and would cause an error: - `/routes/users.index.ts` - `/routes/users.ts` - `/routes/users/index.ts` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Mount Directory with Physical Virtual Routes DESCRIPTION: Shows how to mount an entire directory of file-based routes under a specific URL path using the `physical` function. This allows mixing conventions within the route tree. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/react/routing/virtual-file-routes.md#_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: tsx CODE: ``` import { index, layout, physical, route, rootRoute } from '@tanstack/virtual-file-routes' export const routes = rootRoute('root.tsx', [ index('index.tsx'), layout('pathlessLayout.tsx', [ route('/dashboard', 'app/dashboard.tsx', [ index('app/dashboard-index.tsx'), route('/invoices', 'app/dashboard-invoices.tsx', [ index('app/invoices-index.tsx'), route('$id', 'app/invoice-detail.tsx'), ]), ]), physical('/posts', 'posts'), ]), ]) ``` ======================== QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS ======================== TOPIC: Q: How can you create a file-based route? A: You can create a file-based route using the `createFileRoute` function. This function is designed to work with file-based routing conventions, simplifying the process of defining routes based on your file structure. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/react/api/router.md#_qa_4 ---------------------------------------- TOPIC: TanStack Router Virtual File Routes Q: What is the purpose of virtual file routes in TanStack Router? A: Virtual file routes allow you to define routes based on a file structure, similar to how frameworks like Next.js handle routing. This approach simplifies route management by automatically generating routes from your file system. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/solid/routing/virtual-file-routes.md#_qa_0 ---------------------------------------- TOPIC: TanStack Router: File-Based Routing Q: What is file-based routing in TanStack Router? A: File-based routing is a method for configuring routes in TanStack Router by using the filesystem. Instead of defining routes in code, you create files and directories that mirror your application's URL structure. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/react/routing/file-based-routing.md#_qa_0 ---------------------------------------- TOPIC: Q: Which files and folders are excluded from the route tree based on file naming conventions? A: Files and folders with a `-` prefix are excluded from the route tree. They are not added to the `routeTree.gen.ts` file and can be used for colocation. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/react/routing/file-naming-conventions.md#_qa_5 ---------------------------------------- TOPIC: TanStack Router: File-Based Routing Q: How are dynamic route segments handled in file-based routing? A: Dynamic route segments are handled by prefixing the filename with a `$`. For instance, a file named `$postId.tsx` within a `posts` directory will create a route for `/posts/:postId`. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/react/routing/file-based-routing.md#_qa_6 ---------------------------------------- TOPIC: TanStack Router File Naming Conventions Q: What is the purpose of file-naming conventions in TanStack Router for React? A: File-naming conventions in TanStack Router for React help automatically generate routes based on your file structure. This simplifies routing configuration by mapping file paths to URL paths. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/solid/routing/file-naming-conventions.md#_qa_0 ---------------------------------------- TOPIC: TanStack Router: File-Based Routing Q: What are the benefits of using file-based routing? A: File-based routing offers simplicity, better organization mirroring URL structure, scalability, automatic code-splitting for performance, enhanced type-safety, and consistency across projects. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/react/routing/file-based-routing.md#_qa_1 ---------------------------------------- TOPIC: File-Based Routing API Reference Q: What are the configuration options available for TanStack Router's file-based routing? A: TanStack Router's file-based routing offers several configuration options including `routesDirectory`, `generatedRouteTree`, `virtualRouteConfig`, `routeFilePrefix`, `routeFileIgnorePrefix`, `indexToken`, `routeToken`, `quoteStyle`, `semicolons`, `apiBase`, `autoCodeSplitting`, `disableTypes`, `addExtensions`, `disableLogging`, `routeTreeFileHeader`, `routeTreeFileFooter`, `enableRouteTreeFormatting`, and `tmpDir`. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/api/file-based-routing.md#_qa_0 ---------------------------------------- TOPIC: TanStack Router: File-Based Routing Q: How is the root index route defined? A: The root index route, which corresponds to the application's base URL (`/`), is defined by an `index.tsx` file in the root directory. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/docs/router/framework/react/routing/file-based-routing.md#_qa_5 ---------------------------------------- TOPIC: TanStack Router Plugin Q: What is the TanStack Router Plugin? A: The TanStack Router Plugin is a tool that enhances TanStack Router with file-based routing capabilities. It allows you to define your routes based on the file structure of your project. SOURCE: https://github.com/tanstack/router/blob/main/packages/router-plugin/README.md#_qa_0

content.text:
TanStack Router handles file-based routing through several key mechanisms:

## File Structure Mapping
Routes are automatically generated based on your file and directory structure:
- `__root.tsx` â†’ Root component
- `index.tsx` â†’ `/` (root index)
- `about.tsx` â†’ `/about`
- `posts.tsx` â†’ `/posts`
- `posts/index.tsx` â†’ `/posts/` (exact)
- `posts/$postId.tsx` â†’ `/posts/:postId` (dynamic segment)

## Flat vs Directory Conventions
You can use either approach or mix them:
- **Flat**: `posts.$postId.edit.tsx` â†’ `/posts/:postId/edit`
- **Directory**: `posts/$postId/edit.tsx` â†’ `/posts/:postId/edit`

## Special Files & Conventions
- **Root route**: `__root.tsx` (required)
- **Index routes**: Files named `index.tsx` match the exact parent path
- **Layout routes**: Files named `route.tsx` or using the `routeToken`
- **Dynamic segments**: Prefix with `$` (e.g., `$postId.tsx`)
- **Catch-all routes**: Use `$.tsx`
- **Pathless layouts**: Prefix with `_` (e.g., `_pathlessLayout.tsx`)

## File Exclusion
Files/folders prefixed with `-` are excluded from routing and can be used for co-location of components, utilities, etc.

## Configuration
Configure routing behavior in `tsr.config.json`:
```json
{
  "routesDirectory": "./src/routes",
  "generatedRouteTree": "./src/routeTree.gen.ts",
  "routeFilePrefix": "",
  "routeFileIgnorePrefix": "-",
  "indexToken": "index",
  "routeToken": "route"
}
```

The router automatically generates a type-safe route tree from your file structure, enabling full TypeScript support and automatic code-splitting.
